WordCounter

Class WordCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordCounter.WordCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CONSTANTS

    public class WordCounter
extends java.lang.Object
implements CONSTANTS
    This class is used to count post-normalized text from a specified .txt directory.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • countTheWords

        public void countTheWords()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method counts the word occurrences in a pre-normalized text file. It saves the occurence count in an ArrayList and it sorts the occurrences from most frequent to least frequent. The method concludes with writing the ArrayList to a text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This method can throw an IOException.

      • sortWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<Word> sortWords(java.util.ArrayList<Word> wordList)
        This method uses the JCF to sort word objects in an Array List.
        Parameters:
        wordList - The method must be passed a populated Array List of Word objects that is to be sorted.
        Returns:
        The sorted Array List of Word objects is returned.

      • countWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<Word> countWords(java.io.File file,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<Word> wordList,
                                            int expectednumber)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method takes a File object and an Array List. It reads the file and counts the words in the file. The file must be normalized to be counted.
        Parameters:
        file - The file object is the file that contain the words that are to be processed.
        wordList - The Array List will be populated and returned.
        expectednumber - This is the number of words that the user expects to be counted.
        Returns:
        The Array List will be populated as words are counted and returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file that is to be read is not found, then it will throw this exception.
